query: synthetic biology gene circuit CRISPR metabolic engineering cell-free biosensor genetic toggle switch oscillator optogenetics

concepts.label: synthetic biology
concepts.description: Engineering discipline enabling precise design and control of biological systems through construction of genetic circuits and novel molecular parts.

concepts.label: genetic circuit
concepts.description: Engineered DNA-based regulatory network composed of genetic elements that produce defined cellular behaviors and outputs.

concepts.label: systems biology
concepts.description: Computational and experimental approach to study cellular behavior and system-level properties through dynamic modeling and integration of interactions.

concepts.label: inositol phosphorylceramide synthase
concepts.description: Enzyme in Leishmania parasites involved in lipid biosynthesis and membrane composition regulation.

concepts.label: Leishmania
concepts.description: Protozoan parasite causing leishmaniasis; used as model organism for synthetic circuit construction in this study.

concepts.label: circuit simulation
concepts.description: Computational modeling and prediction of dynamic behavior of engineered genetic circuits before experimental validation.

concepts.label: circuit validation
concepts.description: Experimental verification of genetic circuit function and predicted behavior through qualitative and quantitative measurements.

concepts.label: oscillatory behavior
concepts.description: Cyclical temporal dynamics in circuit output where molecular concentrations periodically rise and fall.

concepts.label: bistability
concepts.description: Circuit property where two distinct stable states are possible; system switches between alternative cellular phenotypes.

concepts.label: robustness
concepts.description: Property of circuit design ensuring stable and reproducible behavior despite cellular noise and parameter variation.

concepts.label: cellular state control
concepts.description: Ability to precisely manipulate and regulate intracellular conditions and molecular phenotypes using engineered genetic systems.

concepts.label: genetic element
concepts.description: Basic molecular components such as promoters, coding sequences, and regulatory regions used to build synthetic circuits.

concepts.label: Modular Assembly
concepts.description: Engineering approach that combines standardized, independently functional genetic sequences into larger biological systems.

concepts.label: Genetic Sequences
concepts.description: DNA or RNA sequences that encode functional information and serve as the physical substrate for biological devices.

concepts.label: Biological Systems
concepts.description: Complex networks of interacting molecular, cellular, or organism-level components that exhibit emergent biological functions.

concepts.label: Functional Design
concepts.description: Engineering paradigm that prioritizes specification and implementation of biological function as the primary design objective.

concepts.label: Sequence-Function Coupling
concepts.description: Traditional synthetic biology approach where sequence specification and functional behavior are tightly entangled, limiting abstraction and reuse.

concepts.label: Abstraction
concepts.description: Conceptual separation between sequence-level details and functional specifications, enabling modular reuse and design simplification.

concepts.label: Design Reuse
concepts.description: Practice of applying previously engineered biological devices to new applications and contexts without complete redesign.

concepts.label: Predictability
concepts.description: Ability to reliably forecast the functional behavior of engineered biological systems from their design specifications.

concepts.label: Engineering Flexibility
concepts.description: Capacity to rapidly adapt, reconfigure, or repurpose biological devices across diverse applications and experimental contexts.

concepts.label: Functional Synthetic Biology
concepts.description: Emerging paradigm in synthetic biology that decouples sequence design from functional specification to improve modularity, reusability, and predictability.

concepts.label: Software Tooling
concepts.description: Computational infrastructure and algorithms supporting design, specification, and implementation of biological systems.

concepts.label: genetic toggle switch
concepts.description: A synthetic gene circuit consisting of two genes whose protein products mutually repress each other's expression, exhibiting bistable behavior.

concepts.label: repressilator
concepts.description: A synthetic gene circuit composed of three genes arranged in a cyclic repression pattern, where each gene's protein product represses the next gene's expression.

concepts.label: protein repression
concepts.description: A regulatory mechanism in which a protein product inhibits the expression or transcription of another gene.

concepts.label: feedback
concepts.description: A regulatory mechanism in which the output of a system influences its own input, either enhancing (positive) or dampening (negative) the system's response.

concepts.label: phase diagram
concepts.description: A graphical representation of parameter space showing regions where different dynamical behaviors or phases occur.

concepts.label: parameter space
concepts.description: The multidimensional space of all possible parameter values characterizing a system's behavior.

concepts.label: introductory physics education
concepts.description: Foundational physics instruction at the undergraduate level, typically covering classical mechanics, thermodynamics, and waves.

concepts.label: quantitative analysis
concepts.description: Mathematical or numerical treatment of a system to determine its properties, behavior, and relationships.

concepts.label: Bayesian uncertainty analysis
concepts.description: Statistical framework for quantifying and propagating uncertainty in model parameters and predictions using Bayesian inference.

concepts.label: systems biology models
concepts.description: Mathematical representations of biological processes integrating multiple molecular and cellular components to simulate system-level behavior.

concepts.label: global parameter search
concepts.description: Systematic exploration of a high-dimensional parameter space to identify all regions consistent with observational data.

concepts.label: Bayesian emulator
concepts.description: Fast statistical surrogate model trained to approximate the behavior of a computationally expensive simulator while quantifying uncertainty.

concepts.label: history matching
concepts.description: Iterative Bayesian method for systematically narrowing parameter space by identifying regions where model predictions are inconsistent with observed data.

concepts.label: model evaluation time
concepts.description: Computational cost or runtime required to simulate a mathematical model given a particular parameter set.

concepts.label: uncertainty quantification
concepts.description: Process of characterizing, propagating, and communicating sources and magnitude of uncertainty in model parameters and predictions.

concepts.label: gene function evaluation
concepts.description: Analysis of the biological role and regulatory effects of genes within a system using model-based comparison with observed data.

concepts.label: hormonal crosstalk
concepts.description: Regulatory interactions between signaling pathways mediated by plant hormones in developmental processes.

concepts.label: Arabidopsis root development
concepts.description: Biological system governing growth and tissue differentiation in Arabidopsis thaliana root organs, regulated by multiple hormonal signals.

concepts.label: rate parameters
concepts.description: Kinetic parameters quantifying reaction rates, transport rates, or gene expression rates in biological models.

concepts.label: observed trend data
concepts.description: Experimental measurements or qualitative observations of biological variables used to constrain model behavior.

concepts.label: CRISPR-based transcription regulator
concepts.description: Synthetic artificial transcriptional regulator using CRISPR technology to specifically activate or repress target genes.

concepts.label: guide RNA
concepts.description: RNA molecule that directs CRISPR machinery to specific DNA sequences for targeted gene regulation.

concepts.label: metabolic pathway
concepts.description: Interconnected series of enzymatic reactions that convert substrates to products in living cells.

concepts.label: metabolic flux
concepts.description: The rate and directionality of substrate flow through metabolic pathways.

concepts.label: gene expression
concepts.description: Process by which information from a gene is synthesized into functional gene products, including transcription and translation.

concepts.label: data-driven predictive model
concepts.description: Computational model trained on empirical datasets to predict outcomes without explicit mechanistic rules.

concepts.label: metabolic engineering
concepts.description: Rational design and optimization of metabolic pathways to improve production of desired compounds.

concepts.label: DNA targeting site location
concepts.description: The genomic position where guide RNAs bind within a genetic cassette, determining regulatory effects.

concepts.label: programmable control
concepts.description: Rational tuning and modulation of biological processes through designed genetic elements.

concepts.label: gene activation
concepts.description: Upregulation of gene expression to increase transcript and protein production.

concepts.label: chemical production yield
concepts.description: The quantity of desired product obtained per unit of substrate or time in biomanufacturing processes.

concepts.label: Gene Ontology
concepts.description: A comprehensive resource for cataloguing and standardising gene function annotations across species.

concepts.label: ontology structure
concepts.description: The hierarchical organisation and logical framework underlying the Gene Ontology classification system.

concepts.label: gene function
concepts.description: The biological role, activity, or process performed by a gene or its protein product.

concepts.label: annotation
concepts.description: Association of gene products with standardised GO terms to describe their function, location, or involvement in processes.

concepts.label: data analysis
concepts.description: Computational and statistical methods used to extract biological insights from genomic and functional datasets.

concepts.label: cataloguing
concepts.description: Systematic organisation and classification of biological information into a structured resource.

concepts.label: mean-field analysis
concepts.description: Analytical technique that approximates stochastic systems by replacing fluctuating variables with their average values.

concepts.label: stochastic simulations
concepts.description: Computational method that models probabilistic dynamics of molecular systems accounting for random fluctuations.

concepts.label: reactive flux theory
concepts.description: Framework for calculating reaction rates by analyzing molecular flux through transition regions in phase space.

concepts.label: transition state theory
concepts.description: Theory that relates reaction rates to the free energy barrier between reactant and product states.

concepts.label: switch lifetime
concepts.description: Characteristic timescale for the genetic toggle to flip between its two stable states; a measure of switch stability.

concepts.label: transcription factor molecules
concepts.description: Proteins that regulate gene expression by binding to DNA and controlling the rate of transcription.

concepts.label: gene expression noise
concepts.description: Stochastic fluctuations in the production and degradation of mRNA and proteins arising from the discrete nature of molecular reactions.

concepts.label: shot noise
concepts.description: Fluctuations in gene expression arising from the production of multiple protein copies from a single mRNA transcript.

concepts.label: protein copy number fluctuations
concepts.description: Variability in the number of protein molecules produced per mRNA transcript due to stochastic translation.

concepts.label: transcription factor binding domain
concepts.description: DNA region where transcription factors bind to regulate gene expression; spatial arrangement affects competitive binding.

concepts.label: exclusive binding
concepts.description: Arrangement of transcription factor binding domains such that competing factors mutually exclude each other on the DNA.

concepts.label: switch barrier
concepts.description: Free energy barrier separating the two stable states of a genetic toggle switch; determines switching probability.

concepts.label: kinetic prefactor
concepts.description: Attempt frequency factor in transition rate theory that determines the rate of barrier crossing attempts.

concepts.label: GO annotations
concepts.description: Associations between gene products and ontology terms that describe their biological functions, processes, or cellular locations.

concepts.label: ontology relations
concepts.description: Logical connections between ontology terms such as 'is-a' and 'part-of' that structure the hierarchy and determine inference rules.

concepts.label: transitivity
concepts.description: The property that if A relates to B and B relates to C, then A relates to C; applicable to some but not all ontology relations.

concepts.label: annotation qualifiers
concepts.description: Metadata tags that modify GO annotations to indicate negation, restricted scope, or conditional applicability of term assignments.

concepts.label: data incompleteness
concepts.description: The systematic absence of annotations in GO due to incomplete curation, leading to false negatives in analyses.

concepts.label: gene enrichment analysis
concepts.description: A statistical method identifying significantly over-represented ontology terms in a list of genes relative to a background set.

concepts.label: annotation bias
concepts.description: Systematic skewing of GO annotations toward well-studied genes, popular functions, or specific organisms, confounding aggregate analyses.

concepts.label: directed acyclic graph
concepts.description: A graph structure used by GO where terms are nodes connected by directed edges with no cycles, allowing multiple parents per term.

concepts.label: ontology misinterpretation
concepts.description: Incorrect understanding of GO structure, term definitions, or annotation semantics leading to flawed biological conclusions.

concepts.label: is-a relation
concepts.description: An ontology relation indicating that one term is a subclass of another, supporting upward inference through transitivity.

concepts.label: part-of relation
concepts.description: An ontology relation indicating that one term represents a component of another; transitivity is not always applicable.

concepts.label: reinforcement learning
concepts.description: A machine learning paradigm where an agent learns to make sequential decisions by interacting with an environment and receiving reward signals.

concepts.label: external control
concepts.description: A strategy for manipulating or stabilizing a biological system through exogenous inputs or interventions applied from outside the system.

concepts.label: sim-to-real transfer
concepts.description: A paradigm where a control policy or model is trained in simulation and then deployed on a real physical or biological system.

concepts.label: data efficiency
concepts.description: The ability of a learning algorithm to achieve good performance with minimal amounts of training data or system interactions.

concepts.label: policy
concepts.description: In reinforcement learning, a mapping from states to actions that defines the behavior of a learning agent.

concepts.label: simplified model
concepts.description: A reduced-complexity mathematical or computational representation of a biological system used for efficient learning and prediction.

concepts.label: realistic model
concepts.description: A detailed computational model parameterized from experimental data that more accurately represents actual biological system behavior.

concepts.label: in-vivo experiments
concepts.description: Biological experiments conducted within a living organism or cell, providing empirical parameters for system characterization.

concepts.label: in-silico experiments
concepts.description: Computational simulations and modeling studies performed entirely on a computer without biological implementation.

concepts.label: system stabilization
concepts.description: The process of controlling a dynamical system to maintain it in a desired stable state or trajectory.

concepts.label: CRISPR-GPT
concepts.description: An LLM-based agentic system augmented with domain knowledge and external tools to automate the design and execution of CRISPR gene-editing experiments.

concepts.label: Large Language Models
concepts.description: Neural network models trained on large text corpora to perform reasoning and generation tasks; can be augmented with domain knowledge and external tools.

concepts.label: CRISPR technology
concepts.description: Genome engineering technology enabling precise, targeted modifications to genetic information in living cells.

concepts.label: CRISPR system selection
concepts.description: The process of choosing appropriate CRISPR nuclease and regulatory components suited to the specific gene-editing application.

concepts.label: Cellular delivery methods
concepts.description: Techniques and protocols for introducing CRISPR components (nucleases, guide RNAs) into target cells.

concepts.label: Experimental protocol
concepts.description: A detailed step-by-step procedure describing materials, methods, and conditions for conducting a CRISPR gene-editing experiment.

concepts.label: Validation experiments
concepts.description: Experiments designed to confirm and verify that intended genetic modifications have been successfully introduced and are functional.

concepts.label: Gene-editing design
concepts.description: The systematic process of planning and optimizing all components of a CRISPR experiment from target selection through validation.

concepts.label: Domain knowledge
concepts.description: Specialized knowledge about CRISPR systems, molecular biology, and experimental best practices integrated into the LLM agent.

concepts.label: Genome engineering
concepts.description: The discipline of making precise, intentional modifications to DNA sequences and chromosomal organization in living organisms.

concepts.label: Biological design problem
concepts.description: Complex questions or challenges in synthetic biology and genome engineering requiring domain expertise and reasoning to solve.

concepts.label: External tools
concepts.description: Computational and laboratory resources, software, and databases integrated with the LLM agent to enhance its capabilities.

concepts.label: Ethical considerations
concepts.description: Moral and responsible principles governing the development and use of automated gene-editing technologies.

concepts.label: Regulatory compliance
concepts.description: Adherence to governmental and institutional guidelines governing the use and reporting of genome engineering technologies.

concepts.label: synthetic rescue
concepts.description: A genetic interaction where deletion of a second gene restores viability or function lost due to an initial gene deletion.

concepts.label: flux balance analysis
concepts.description: Computational method that constrains metabolic networks using stoichiometry and optimisation to predict metabolic flux distributions.

concepts.label: gene deletion
concepts.description: Removal or knockout of a gene, eliminating the expression of the corresponding protein or enzyme.

concepts.label: essential gene
concepts.description: A gene required for cell viability or normal growth under standard conditions.

concepts.label: mutation
concepts.description: A change in DNA sequence that can alter or eliminate gene function, causing cellular defects.

concepts.label: cellular function
concepts.description: The biological capabilities and activities performed by cells to maintain viability and respond to environmental signals.

concepts.label: compensatory mechanism
concepts.description: A cellular adaptation or alternative pathway that restores lost function through alternative routes or gene activities.

concepts.label: phenotype
concepts.description: The observable characteristics or functional state of an organism resulting from its genotype and environment.

concepts.label: growth rate
concepts.description: The rate at which cells increase in mass or number; a key measure of metabolic fitness.

concepts.label: genetic intervention
concepts.description: A therapeutic or experimental strategy that modifies gene expression or genomic sequences to alter cellular function.

concepts.label: bypass pathway
concepts.description: An alternative metabolic route that circumvents a blocked enzymatic step to restore flux.

concepts.label: Biology-derived algorithms
concepts.description: Computational methods inspired by or derived from natural biological processes and mechanisms.

concepts.label: Genetic algorithms
concepts.description: Evolutionary optimization algorithms that mimic natural selection and genetic variation to solve search and optimization problems.

concepts.label: Neural networks
concepts.description: Computational models inspired by biological neurons that process information through interconnected nodes to learn patterns and perform inference.

concepts.label: Cellular automata
concepts.description: Discrete computational models consisting of grid-based cells that evolve according to local transition rules, exhibiting emergent behavior.

concepts.label: Natural evolution
concepts.description: Biological process of adaptive change in populations through selection, mutation, and reproduction over generations.

concepts.label: Biological activities
concepts.description: Processes and mechanisms occurring in living organisms such as neural signaling, adaptation, and population dynamics.

concepts.label: Engineering optimization
concepts.description: Application of computational and mathematical techniques to find optimal solutions in engineering design and problem-solving.

concepts.label: Computational sciences
concepts.description: Scientific discipline focusing on solving problems using computational methods and algorithms.

concepts.label: synthetic biochemical circuits
concepts.description: Engineered molecular systems composed of DNA, RNA, and proteins designed to perform information processing functions.

concepts.label: positive autoregulation
concepts.description: Gene regulatory motif where a product enhances its own production, creating a self-amplifying feedback loop.

concepts.label: synthetic DNA switch
concepts.description: Engineered DNA template composed of multiple synthetic oligonucleotide strands that can toggle between two regulatory states.

concepts.label: transcription activator
concepts.description: RNA or protein molecule that enhances RNA synthesis from DNA templates by interacting with RNA polymerase.

concepts.label: T7 RNA polymerase
concepts.description: Bacteriophage-derived single-subunit RNA polymerase that selectively transcribes T7 promoter sequences with high specificity.

concepts.label: RNase H
concepts.description: Ribonuclease that cleaves RNA in RNA-DNA hybrid duplexes; essential for achieving bistability in the synthetic switch.

concepts.label: RNase R
concepts.description: Processive ribonuclease that degrades RNA and removes incomplete degradation products to maintain stable signal levels.

concepts.label: RNA output
concepts.description: Transcription product generated by the synthetic circuit that feeds back to regulate its own synthesis.

concepts.label: thermodynamic constraints
concepts.description: Physical chemical principles governing equilibrium stability and sequence design criteria for the synthetic DNA switch.

concepts.label: mathematical model
concepts.description: Quantitative framework used to describe switch dynamics, fit experimental parameters, and predict system behavior.

concepts.label: RNA degradation
concepts.description: Enzymatic breakdown of RNA transcripts by nucleases, controlling signal amplitude and stability.

concepts.label: metabolators
concepts.description: Synthetic hybrid metabolic-genetic circuits that combine metabolic and genetic regulatory components to generate oscillatory dynamics.

concepts.label: core metabolator
concepts.description: A reference topological circuit architecture serving as the foundational model for studying metabolator family dynamics.

concepts.label: generalized modeling
concepts.description: A mathematical framework for analyzing dynamical systems that studies behavior under general kinetic assumptions without requiring precise rate parameters.

concepts.label: Hopf bifurcation
concepts.description: A local bifurcation where a fixed point loses stability and a periodic orbit (limit cycle) emerges as a system parameter varies.

concepts.label: kinetic models
concepts.description: Mathematical representations of biochemical reaction networks that specify rate equations governing metabolite and protein concentrations.

concepts.label: circuit topology
concepts.description: The directed graph structure encoding regulatory interactions and feedback loops in a genetic or metabolic circuit.

concepts.label: relaxation oscillations
concepts.description: Oscillations characterised by alternating slow and fast motion phases, often arising from separated time scales in a dynamical system.

concepts.label: time scale separation
concepts.description: Coexistence of fast and slow processes in a system; when widely separated, enables reduction techniques and affects bifurcation structure.

concepts.label: local oscillations
concepts.description: Periodic fluctuations that persist in a neighbourhood of equilibrium, typically near a bifurcation point.

concepts.label: global oscillations
concepts.description: Large-amplitude periodic orbits sustained far from equilibrium, typically spanning a significant fraction of the state space.

concepts.label: circuit stability
concepts.description: The property of a circuit to maintain robustness against perturbations and prevent unwanted dynamical transitions.

concepts.label: Computer-aided design
concepts.description: Computational methodology for rational and systematic engineering of biological systems using mathematical models and software tools.

concepts.label: Whole-cell model
concepts.description: Comprehensive multiscale mathematical representation capturing all major cellular processes and linking genotypes to phenotypes.

concepts.label: Multiscale modeling
concepts.description: Mathematical framework that integrates processes across multiple biological scales from molecular to cellular levels.

concepts.label: Genotype-phenotype mapping
concepts.description: Quantitative relationship linking genetic information to observable cellular characteristics and functions.

concepts.label: Design-build-test-learn cycle
concepts.description: Iterative engineering cycle combining computational design, physical construction, experimental validation, and model refinement.

concepts.label: Genome minimization
concepts.description: Engineering strategy to reduce genome size while retaining essential cellular functions.

concepts.label: Cell-free systems
concepts.description: Biochemical systems in vitro lacking cellular membranes but capable of supporting transcription and translation.

concepts.label: DNA assembly
concepts.description: Molecular methods for synthesizing and combining DNA fragments into larger constructs or genomes.

concepts.label: Designer cells
concepts.description: Engineered cellular organisms with bespoke synthetic functions and increased modularity.

concepts.label: MIMO control system
concepts.description: Multi-Input Multi-Output control system where multiple inputs regulate multiple outputs simultaneously.

concepts.label: pulse-width modulation
concepts.description: Control technique that varies the duty cycle of periodic pulses to modulate system behavior in real-time.

concepts.label: inducer molecules
concepts.description: Chemical compounds (aTc and IPTG) that regulate gene expression in the toggle switch by controlling transcriptional repression.

concepts.label: duty cycle
concepts.description: The fraction of time a periodic signal remains in the active state, ranging from 0 to 1.

concepts.label: open-loop control
concepts.description: Control strategy that applies predetermined inputs without real-time feedback from the system output.

concepts.label: average model
concepts.description: Mathematical model that approximates the behavior of a periodically-driven system by averaging its dynamics over pulse periods.

concepts.label: hybrid PI-PWM controller
concepts.description: Feedback controller combining proportional-integral (PI) error correction with pulse-width modulation for real-time duty-cycle adjustment.

concepts.label: Zero-Average dynamics controller
concepts.description: Feedback controller that drives the system state toward a sliding surface by nullifying average dynamics.

concepts.label: deterministic simulation
concepts.description: In-silico model validation using ordinary differential equations assuming no stochastic noise.

concepts.label: stochastic simulation
concepts.description: In-silico model validation using the Stochastic Simulation Algorithm to account for molecular-level noise and discrete events.

concepts.label: Turing patterns
concepts.description: Spatially periodic patterns that emerge from reaction-diffusion systems through symmetry-breaking instability in morphogen gradients.

concepts.label: Gene circuits
concepts.description: Synthetic or natural networks of interacting genes and their products that produce emergent biological behavior.

concepts.label: Pattern switch
concepts.description: A control mechanism that toggles the onset of spatial pattern formation via a single tunable parameter.

concepts.label: Pattern dial
concepts.description: A control mechanism enabling continuous transitions between distinct pattern types through parameter modulation.

concepts.label: Weakly nonlinear amplitude equations
concepts.description: Mathematical framework describing slow dynamics of pattern-forming instabilities near bifurcation points through reduced amplitude variables.

concepts.label: Experimental tunability
concepts.description: The capacity to adjust system output or behavior through controllable experimental parameters in biological systems.

concepts.label: Network size
concepts.description: The number of nodes (genes) or regulatory interactions comprising a gene circuit architecture.

concepts.label: Evolvability
concepts.description: The capacity of a biological system to generate heritable phenotypic variation and adapt through evolution.

concepts.label: Designability
concepts.description: The ease with which a system can be engineered or programmed to achieve desired functional outcomes.

concepts.label: Reaction-diffusion systems
concepts.description: Systems combining chemical reactions with spatial diffusion of molecular species, fundamental to pattern formation.

concepts.label: genetic oscillator
concepts.description: A gene regulatory network that exhibits periodic oscillations in expression levels of one or more genes.

concepts.label: cell physiology
concepts.description: The physical and biochemical state of cells including macromolecular composition, ribosome concentration, and cell volume.

concepts.label: ribosome concentration
concepts.description: The abundance of ribosomes per unit cell volume, a key determinant of translational capacity that varies with growth rate.

concepts.label: oscillation
concepts.description: Periodic temporal fluctuation in the abundance of gene products or regulatory molecules in a genetic circuit.

concepts.label: fixed point
concepts.description: A steady-state equilibrium solution of a dynamical system where concentrations remain constant in time.

concepts.label: negative feedback
concepts.description: A regulatory mechanism where a gene product inhibits the expression of genes upstream in its regulatory pathway, enabling oscillatory behavior.

concepts.label: plasmid
concepts.description: An extrachromosomal circular DNA molecule used as a vehicle for genetic circuit implementation in synthetic biology.

concepts.label: oscillation period
concepts.description: The time interval for one complete cycle of oscillation in a genetic oscillator.

concepts.label: oscillation amplitude
concepts.description: The magnitude of fluctuation from baseline in the abundance of oscillating gene products.

concepts.label: cell volume
concepts.description: The physical volume occupied by a bacterial cell, which scales with growth rate and affects molecular concentrations.

concepts.label: Symmetry
concepts.description: Mathematical principle characterizing invariance under transformations; fundamental to physics from classical mechanics through quantum theory.

concepts.label: Symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Process by which a system transitions from a symmetric state to one with reduced symmetry, enabling phase transitions and pattern formation.

concepts.label: Classical physics
concepts.description: Framework of mechanics and electromagnetism based on deterministic laws and absolute space-time, prior to relativistic and quantum revisions.

concepts.label: Relativistic physics
concepts.description: Theory of spacetime and gravitation incorporating Einstein's principle of relativity and constancy of the speed of light.

concepts.label: Quantum physics
concepts.description: Theory describing behaviour of matter and energy at atomic and subatomic scales, governed by wave-particle duality and probabilistic outcomes.

concepts.label: Conservation laws
concepts.description: Principles stating that certain physical quantities (energy, momentum, charge) remain constant in isolated systems.

concepts.label: Stability
concepts.description: Property of a system to maintain or return to its state when subject to perturbations.

concepts.label: Critical transitions
concepts.description: Abrupt changes in system behaviour at critical points, characterized by extended variability and reorganization across organizational levels.

concepts.label: Biological organism
concepts.description: Living system exhibiting organization across multiple hierarchical levels from molecular to organismal scales.

concepts.label: Viability interval
concepts.description: Range of conditions and structural variations within which a biological system maintains functional integrity and continued existence.

concepts.label: Variability
concepts.description: Inherent differences and fluctuations in biological systems, fundamental to adaptive processes and extended critical transitions.

concepts.label: Noether's theorem
concepts.description: Fundamental result linking continuous symmetries to conservation laws in physical systems.

concepts.label: graphene
concepts.description: Two-dimensional carbon allotrope with exceptional electronic, thermal, and mechanical properties used as a sensing material in biosensors.

concepts.label: field-effect transistor
concepts.description: Semiconductor device that modulates electrical conductance through an applied electric field, used for signal transduction in biosensing.

concepts.label: graphene field-effect transistor
concepts.description: FET device incorporating graphene as the active sensing channel for ultrasensitive bioanalyte detection.

concepts.label: biosensor
concepts.description: Analytical device combining a biological recognition element with a physical transducer to detect and quantify target analytes.

concepts.label: nanomaterial
concepts.description: Material with structural features at the nanoscale that exhibits enhanced properties compared to bulk materials.

concepts.label: virus detection
concepts.description: Identification and quantification of viral particles or viral antigens in biological samples.

concepts.label: SARS-CoV-2
concepts.description: Coronavirus responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic, requiring rapid and reliable diagnostic detection methods.

concepts.label: sensitivity
concepts.description: Ability of a biosensor to detect small quantities of analyte and produce a measurable signal change.

concepts.label: signal transduction
concepts.description: Conversion of binding events at the biosensor surface into measurable electrical or physical signals.

concepts.label: rapid detection
concepts.description: Quick identification and quantification of target analytes with minimal processing time.

concepts.label: low-noise detection
concepts.description: Biosensing technique that minimizes background electrical noise to improve signal-to-noise ratio and measurement accuracy.

edges.evidence: Synthetic biology enables the precise control of cellular states through construction of genetic circuits for systems studies.
Genetic circuit was designed for the targeted enzyme inositol phosphorylceramide synthase belonging to Leishmania.
To explore the dynamic nature of the circuit designed, simulation was done followed by circuit validation.
Simulation was performed followed by circuit validation by qualitative and quantitative approaches.
The genetic circuit shows responsiveness, oscillatory and bistable behavior.
The genetic circuit designed shows oscillatory and bistable behavior.
The genetic circuit shows intrinsic robustness together with responsiveness and oscillatory behavior.
Synthetic biology enables the precise control of cellular states for systems studies.
Circuit construction for protozoan parasite Leishmania; no prior literature reports exist for such synthetic circuits in parasites.
Building circuits and studying their behavior in cells is a major goal of systems and synthetic biology.
Genetic circuits are composed of genetic elements; synthetic biology facilitates discovery of novel parts and control strategies.
Synthetic biologists have made great progress in developing methods for modular assembly of genetic sequences.
Methods for modular assembly of genetic sequences combine standardized components.
Engineering biological systems by assembling genetic sequences creates devices with various functions.
Current paradigms entangle sequence and functionality in a manner that makes abstraction difficult.
Current paradigms reduce engineering flexibility.
Entanglement of sequence and functionality impairs predictability and design reuse.
The entanglement of sequence and functionality impairs design reuse.
Functional Synthetic Biology aims to focus design on function, rather than on sequence.
Focusing on function rather than sequence enables abstraction by decoupling devices from their specific use.
Functional focus allows more flexibility in how devices are used.
Functional design creates more opportunity for reuse of devices and data.
Separating sequence from function leads to improvements in predictability.
Realizing the vision of Functional Synthetic Biology requires supporting software tooling.
Abstraction decouples engineering of devices from their specifics, enabling reuse.
The genetic toggle switch is described as a synthetic gene circuit consisting of two genes.
The repressilator is described as a synthetic gene circuit composed of three genes.
Analytic, numerical, and electronic treatments of the genetic toggle switch shows that this gene circuit realizes bistability.
A simplified treatment of the repressilator reveals that this circuit can realize sustained oscillations.
The genetic toggle switch consists of two genes, each of whose protein product represses the other's expression.
The repressilator consists of three genes, each of whose protein product represses the next gene's expression.
Gene circuits and feedback are discussed together in the context of an educational module on gene circuits and feedback.
The genetic toggle switch and repressilator are analyzed quantitatively using analytic, numerical, and electronic treatments.
A phase diagram specifies the region of parameter space in which bistability or oscillatory behavior occurs.
A phase diagram specifies the region of parameter space in which bistability or oscillatory behavior occurs.
A phase diagram specifies the region of parameter space in which different behaviors occur.
Gene circuits constitute the final topic of a year-long introductory physics sequence for biology and premedical students.
